com.myscript.atk.math.widget

Interface MathWidgetApi


  • public interface MathWidgetApi
    This interface describes the public API of the Math Widget.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  MathWidgetApi.AdditionalGestures
      Gestures options.
      static class  MathWidgetApi.AngleUnit
      Angle unit enum.
      static interface  MathWidgetApi.OnConfigureListener
      Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked at the beginning and end of a handwriting configuration process.
      static interface  MathWidgetApi.OnGestureListener
      Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked when gestures are detected.
      static interface  MathWidgetApi.OnPenListener
      Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked when the user is writing on the widget.
      static interface  MathWidgetApi.OnRecognitionListener
      Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked at the beginning and end of a recognition session.
      static interface  MathWidgetApi.OnSolvingListener
      These methods are called by the solver at the end of the calculations to notify a change in the unit of angle use.
      static interface  MathWidgetApi.OnUndoRedoListener
      Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked when at least one of Undo/Redo stacks has changed.
      static class  MathWidgetApi.RecognitionBeautification
      Beautification options.
      static class  MathWidgetApi.RoundingMode
      Rounding mode enum.
      static class  MathWidgetApi.Symbol
      Structure used to describe each of the recognition result symbols when exporting.

    • Method Detail

      • setTypeface

        void setTypeface(Typeface typeface)
        Set equation text font. Default font is STIXGeneral.ttf if available in assets folder or default application font otherwise.
        Parameters:
        typeface - Typeface of the text.

      • setItalicTypeface

        void setItalicTypeface(Typeface italicTypeface)
        Set equation text font for items that will be italicized like variable names. Default value is null. When null, the italics is calculated based on the text font.
        Parameters:
        italicTypeface - Typeface of the italicized text.

      • setTextColor

        void setTextColor(int color)
        Set the color of the text. Default is #FF4B5775
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the text.

      • setTransientTextColor

        void setTransientTextColor(int color)
        Set the color of the text added by the solver. Default is #FFAAAAAA
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the text.

      • setInkColor

        void setInkColor(int color)
        Set the color of the ink. Default is same as textColor.
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the ink.

      • setInkThickness

        void setInkThickness(int thickness)
        Set the thickness of the ink. Default is 10 pixels.
        Parameters:
        thickness - Thickness of the ink.

      • setBackgroundColor

        void setBackgroundColor(int color)
        Set the background color of the writing area. Default is #FFFFFFFF
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the background.

      • setBackgroundDrawable

        void setBackgroundDrawable(Drawable drawable)
        Set a background to the write area. Default is millimeter_background.
        Parameters:
        drawable - Pattern or image to apply.

      • setPaddingRatio

        void setPaddingRatio(float left,
                     float top,
                     float right,
                     float bottom)
        Set padding ratio.

        The user can write within the margins but no character will be displayed there.
        The values of the margins must be in the range 0.0 to 1.0.
        0.0 means no margins. 1.0 means that the margin will take a quarter of the widget width/height.
        It replaces the previous writeAreaHorizontalMargin and writeAreaVerticalMargin APIs.

        Parameters:
        left - A value between 0.0 and 1.0 which is a fraction of a quarter screen width (default is 0.1).
        top - A value between 0.0 and 1.0 which is a fraction of a quarter screen height (default is 0.1).
        right - A value between 0.0 and 1.0 which is a fraction of a quarter screen width (default is 0.1).
        bottom - A value between 0.0 and 1.0 which is a fraction of a quarter screen height (default is 0.1).

      • setBaselineColor

        void setBaselineColor(int color)
        Set the color of the baseline. Default is #FFAAAAAA
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the baseline.

      • setBaselineThickness

        void setBaselineThickness(int thickness)
        Set the thickness of the baseline. Default is 1 pixel.
        Parameters:
        thickness - Thickness of the baseline. thickness > 0.

      • setBaselineStyle

        void setBaselineStyle(DashPathEffect effect)
        Set the style of the baseline.
        Parameters:
        effect - Effect applied to the baseline.

      • setOnConfigureListener

        void setOnConfigureListener(MathWidgetApi.OnConfigureListener listener)
        Register a callback to be invoked at the beginning and end of a configuration process.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to attach to this widget.
        See Also:
        MathWidgetApi.OnConfigureListener

      • getErrorString

        String getErrorString()
        Return a string describing the error that happened during the configuration, if any.
        Returns:
        String describing the error.

      • setGesturesEnabled

        void setGesturesEnabled(int gestures)
        Set gestures that should be recognized.
        Parameters:
        gestures - Gestures to enable. See MathWidgetApi.AdditionalGestures

      • registerCertificate

        boolean registerCertificate(byte[] certificate)
        Register the certificate to use the MathWidget.

        This function is non-blocking and returns immediately.

        Parameters:
        certificate - Byte array containing the equation recognition certificate.
        Returns:
        true if the certificate is registered or false if a certificate is already registered.

      • addSearchDir

        void addSearchDir(String directoryName)
        Define the location of the equation recognition resources.

        The equation recognition resources are normally loaded automatically from default application data location:

        1. Application bundled data directory

        You can choose to load the equation recognition resource from a different path using this function.

        Parameters:
        directoryName - Path to equation resources

      • clearSearchPath

        void clearSearchPath()
        Clear the location of the equation recognition resources. You can choose to load the equation recognition resource from a different path using this function.

      • configure

        void configure(String bundleName,
               String config)
        Configure the equation recognition engine.

        This function is non-blocking and returns immediately.

        Configuration is a lengthy process that may take up to several seconds, depending on the equation resource attached. It is recommended to setup a configure listener to detect the end of the configuration process.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - The name of the configurations bundle
        config - The name of the configuration
        See Also:
        MathWidgetApi.OnConfigureListener

      • release

        void release()
        Release current equation recognition engine.

      • setOnRecognitionListener

        void setOnRecognitionListener(MathWidgetApi.OnRecognitionListener listener)
        Register a callback to be invoked at the beginning and end of a recognition session.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to attach to this widget.
        See Also:
        MathWidgetApi.OnRecognitionListener

      • getResultAsText

        String getResultAsText()
        Get the recognition result as a text string.
        Returns:
        The recognition result as string.

      • getResultAsLaTeX

        String getResultAsLaTeX()
        Get the recognition result as a LaTeX text string.
        Returns:
        The recognition result as LaTeX string.

      • getResultAsMathML

        String getResultAsMathML()
        Get the recognition result as a MathML text string.
        Returns:
        The recognition result as MathML string.

        Bitmap getResultAsImage()
        Get the recognition result as an image.
        Returns:
        Bitmap preview of the result.

      • getResultAsSymbolList

        List<MathWidgetApi.Symbol> getResultAsSymbolList()
        Get the recognition result as symbol list.
        Returns:
        The description list of symbols.

      • addSymbol

        void addSymbol(MathWidgetApi.Symbol symbol,
               boolean allowUndo)
        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Append a calculation symbol to the current recognition result.
        Parameters:
        symbol - The description of the symbol to add.
        allowUndo - Indicates whether the undo redo stack must be updated with additions.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the symbol has a bounding box with a null width or height.

      • addSymbols

        void addSymbols(List<MathWidgetApi.Symbol> symbols,
                boolean allowUndo)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Append a calculation symbol list to the current recognition result.
        Parameters:
        symbols - The description list of symbols to add.
        allowUndo - Indicates whether the undo redo stack must be updated with additions.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a symbol has a bounding box with a null width or height .

      • serialize

        byte[] serialize()
        Serialize the current input and recognition result as a byte array.
        Returns:
        the corresponding byte array. Only readable using #unserialize.

      • unserialize

        boolean unserialize(byte[] data)
        Restore an input and recognition result saved using serialize method.
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array to unserialize, provided by #serialize.
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise.

      • setOnSolvingListener

        void setOnSolvingListener(MathWidgetApi.OnSolvingListener listener)
        Register callbacks to be invoked when expression has been solved.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to attach to this widget.
        See Also:
        MathWidgetApi.OnSolvingListener

      • setDecimalsCount

        void setDecimalsCount(int count)
        Set the solver number of decimals. Default is 3
        Parameters:
        count - Decimals count. 0 <= count <= 6

      • setBeautificationOption

        void setBeautificationOption(MathWidgetApi.RecognitionBeautification beautification)
        Enable or disable solving and/or beautification of written equation.
        Parameters:
        beautification - The beautification option. The default value of this property is MathWidgetApi.RecognitionBeautification.BeautifyFontifyAndSolve.

      • getAngleUnit

        MathWidgetApi.AngleUnit getAngleUnit()
        Get the angle unit used in calculations. Default is radian.
        Returns:
        the angle unit used in calculations.

      • setAngleUnit

        void setAngleUnit(MathWidgetApi.AngleUnit unit)
        Set the angle unit to be used in calculations. Default is radian.
        Parameters:
        unit - the angle unit to be used in calculations

      • solve

        void solve()
        Perform on demand solving.

      • getRoundingMode

        MathWidgetApi.RoundingMode getRoundingMode()
        Get the rounding mode used in calculations.
        Returns:
        the rounding mode used in calculations.

      • setRoundingMode

        void setRoundingMode(MathWidgetApi.RoundingMode roundingMode)
        Set the rounding mode to be used in calculations.
        Parameters:
        roundingMode - the rounding mode to be used in calculations

      • clear

        void clear(boolean allowUndo)
        Clear the ink, text and all related objects like redo stack. This also clears the screen.
        Parameters:
        allowUndo - Indicates whether the undo-redo stack must be kept.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Indicate whether the widget content is empty or not.
        Returns:
        true if widget content is empty.

      • setPalmRejectionEnabled

        void setPalmRejectionEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable palm rejection. Enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        enabled - The new enabled or disabled state.

      • setPalmRejectionLeftHanded

        void setPalmRejectionLeftHanded(boolean leftHanded)
        Set palm rejection as left or right handed. Right handed by default.
        Parameters:
        leftHanded - True for a left handed palm rejection configuration. Right handed by default.

        Register callbacks to be invoked when gestures are detected.
        Parameters:

      • penDown

        void penDown(com.myscript.atk.core.CaptureInfo captureInfo)
        Triggers a pen down.
        Parameters:
        captureInfo - The pen down position. 
         struct CaptureInfo
 {
 float x;   // x coordinate
 float y;   // y coordinate
 float f;   // f pressure
 float w;   // w width
 int64_t t; // t timestamp (millisecond)
 };

      • penUp

        void penUp(com.myscript.atk.core.CaptureInfo captureInfo)
        Triggers a pen up.
        Parameters:
        captureInfo - The pen up position. 
         struct CaptureInfo
 {
 float x;   // x coordinate
 float y;   // y coordinate
 float f;   // f pressure
 float w;   // w width
 int64_t t; // t timestamp (millisecond)
 };

      • penMove

        void penMove(com.myscript.atk.core.CaptureInfo captureInfo)
        Triggers a pen move.
        Parameters:
        captureInfo - The pen move position. 
         struct CaptureInfo
 {
 float x;   // x coordinate
 float y;   // y coordinate
 float f;   // f pressure
 float w;   // w width
 int64_t t; // t timestamp (millisecond)
 };

        void addStroke(List<com.myscript.atk.core.CaptureInfo> points)
        Adds a stroke to the MyScript document model.
        Parameters:
        points - Points of the stroke. 
         struct CaptureInfo
 {
 float x;   // x coordinate
 float y;   // y coordinate
 float f;   // f pressure
 float w;   // w width
 int64_t t; // t timestamp (millisecond)
 };
